description: The Big Apple - America's largest city and global center for finance, arts, fashion, and culture. NYC is made up of five boroughs with endless attractions, world-class dining, and 24/7 energy.
bestTimeToVisit: April-June and September-November (mild weather, fewer crowds)

boroughs.name: Manhattan
boroughs.description: The heart of NYC with most major attractions

boroughs.name: Brooklyn
boroughs.description: Hip borough with great food and Brooklyn Bridge views

boroughs.name: Queens
boroughs.description: Most diverse borough with authentic ethnic food

boroughs.name: The Bronx
boroughs.description: Home of Yankees Stadium and the Bronx Zoo

boroughs.name: Staten Island
boroughs.description: Quieter borough accessible by free ferry

topAttractions.name: Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island
topAttractions.description: Iconic symbol of freedom and immigration museum

topAttractions.name: Times Square
topAttractions.note: Very crowded, especially evenings and weekends

topAttractions.name: Brooklyn Bridge
topAttractions.description: Historic suspension bridge with pedestrian walkway

topAttractions.name: High Line
topAttractions.description: Elevated park built on former railway line
topAttractions.length: 1.45 miles from Meatpacking to Hudson Yards

broadway.description: World-famous theater district with 41 professional theaters
tips: Book popular shows months in advance
Same-day lottery tickets available for some shows
TKTS booth in Times Square offers discounted tickets
Wednesday matinee and Sunday shows often cheaper

foodScene.foodTrucks: Halal Guys, street hot dogs, and various ethnic cuisines

airports: JFK - International flights, 45 minutes to Manhattan
LaGuardia - Domestic flights, 30 minutes to Manhattan
transportation.taxi: Yellow cabs are iconic but Uber/Lyft also common
transportation.biking: Citi Bike share system throughout the city
transportation.driving: Not recommended - traffic and parking are terrible

neighborhoods.name: Meatpacking District
neighborhoods.description: Former industrial area, now upscale dining and shopping

nightlife.lateNight: City that never sleeps - many venues open until 4 AM
nightlife.note: Legal drinking age is 21, ID required everywhere

tips: Walk fast and stay to the right
Don't stop in the middle of sidewalks
Subway runs 24/7 but service may be limited late night
Street food is generally safe and delicious
Always look up - amazing architecture everywhere
Free events happen daily - check NYC.gov
Many museums have 'pay what you wish' hours
Book restaurant reservations well in advance
Times Square is tourist central - locals avoid it

budgetGuideline.note: Accommodation is the biggest expense - consider staying in outer boroughs

safety.general: Generally very safe, especially in tourist areas
safety.avoid: Poorly lit areas late at night, empty subway cars

freeActivities: Staten Island Ferry (great Statue of Liberty views)
